entry.text: Again the homepage has been redesigned (mainly internal). Most noteably difference: the downloadscript works much better now, you don't have to rename the file in your filerequester anymore.

Introduced the new SimpleMail User Gallery. Alpha 0.5 has been released. New features are:
Configurable mail download selection added.
Supports 8 bit mime mails (if a SMTP Server don't support them they are encoded on the fly).
Improved the readwindow. Now used extensivly the SimpleHTML engine.
Button images are cached now.
Support of the new SimpleMail User Gallery.
A new alpha 0.4 has been released. Most important new feature is the possibility to configure more then one POP3 server.
I (Hynek) am leaving today and will come back in April so send all mail you send to me also to Sebastian as he will stay here.
New frequently asked questions added to the FAQ.

Alpha-Version 0.3 released! This time we have added quiet a bunch of new features:
Forward button.
The main window has two different views which are switchable within the mainwindow.
Improved the composewindow (some buttons added, also a undo/redo).
The "To" button in the addressbook works now.
Group mails (mails with multiple recipients), mails with attachments, important mails can now easily identified.
Added a small context menu for the mailtreelist, mails can now be marked and hold.
Added the possibility to use your IP-addresss as you domain in the HELO/EHLO dialog. (no X-Authentification-Warning headers anymore).
Added smtp-auth according to rfc2554.
It is now possible to specify which port you would like to use on the servers instead of 25 (SMTP) and 110 (POP3).
Other smaller improvements and bug fixes.
New frequently asked question added to the FAQ.
Added some banners for your homepages made by Richard Wagenführer. You can find them in the downloads-section.
The homepage moves to http://simplemail.sourceforge.net/. A completly new design is introduced.
The second alpha version 0.2 is released.
The first alpha version 0.1 is released.
